column4: i tried sudo invoke-rc.d gdm stop but when I go to start gnome back up, there's just a black screen and a spinning disc icon. Any ideas?
i tried sudo invoke-rc.d gdm stop but when I go to start gnome back up, there's just a black screen and a spinning disc icon. Any ideas?
do you think a PIII 800MHz and 256MB ram can serve as a webserver and a home lan router?
Bakkar: What kind of web pages are you going to be serving? And how many users will hit the server at anytime?
am thnkin about simple website may be a blog, basicly it will need PHP and MySQL, no CMS. how many useres?! depends on my luck!
Bakkar: You'll be fine to start out with but if your blog ever grows some legs and gets popular, you'll probably need another solution
Bakkar: You'll be fine to start out with but if your blog ever grows some legs and gets popular, you'll probably need another solution
and it will be able to serve as a home router as well, no? do you recomeend somethin to start with i.e distro? Clark Connect?!
Bakkar: Yes, you'll be fine to use it as a router (my toaster could be a router if it had linux on it)
thanks then i will install a router and web services on it! thanx
